column2: A powerful practitioner of Necromancy, writing the book known as the Grimoire Necris, which allowed his ascension to undeath
The Dread King was a mighty warrior, giant in stature, armed with a massive sword and covered in ancient heavy armour. He could cut down his enemies in their droves.
A master in the lore of dak magic, able to summon vast armies of undead to fight for him.
He being known as the Dread King was known to have been one of Nagash's most powerful followers, aiding him in his early attempts to bring undeath to the world, he served Nagash well

he Dread King's name was derived from a powerful aura that surrounded him at all times, only the mightiest of beings could face him without physically shaking or panicking, most would be frozen in fear or outright flee
The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares. They are Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.
Animated by Dark Magic, a zombie dragon is an unholy parody of a once-noble beast now borne aloft by great tattered wings, its body covered with thick, withered hide.
Claiming the souls of the living, trapped inside the sword. once filled allows the summoning of great warriors
This strange mystical amulet allows its wearer magical powers but it is a heavy burden some can not bear.

Hailing from the highest peaks of the World's Edge Mountains, Arabyans just like the northern Imperials are willing to pay vast sums of gold for a single egg or chick such the renown of these majestic beasts.
A fine-blade presented to Arabyan Warriors who have proved themselves in battle, gaining them respect from all.
It is said that Armour fashioned from the carapace of the Dune Scorpion is stronger and lighter than any metal variety.
They try to protect the innocent and drive evil from the lands and while the northern men can't see past their own prejudices but there are others in this world who fight for good.
They will do anything in their pursuit of power even bargaining with Chaos or scheming with Ratmen.
From a far-flung tribe, their power and wealth is a great asset.
A sorcerer of skill can bend Djinn to their will, the spirit fighting with every ounce of its strength against its master's enemies, making the magical jars they come from highly sought after.
Elephants are unstoppable beasts. Trained on the battlefield, they lead Araby's leaders to war, wiping out everything that gets in their way.
The longer one spends with the "savages" the easier it is to rile them up in battle.
Some shun the shameful black powder, not you though, you revel in it and all engines of destruction.
You have seen many brothers fall in battle, for that is what the nomads are, my brothers.
The true veterans of Araby are bestowed with titles and finery befitting their contribution to these great lands.
They call him the beast whisperer, for these creatures would truly die for him.
You are wise in the ways of magic and have much to teach others.
The bow is a weapon that never jams, a weapon you can always trust.
Warriors of great armies are decorated in ornate armour taken from the Sultan's personal armory even the slaves!
A great man, master of war, risen through the ranks and rewarded with the Crescent Seal giving them the authority to lead a great Arabyan War Throng.
Some say he was born on a Dhow but all agree he's a master of the sea.
Not many can claim to "own" an army.
An apprentice from the revered Palace of the Wizard Caliph.
Born in the dunes, some will never see him as their equal.
Smoke and loud bangs emanate day and night from this one's tent.
He has more in common with the beasts than his fellow man.
He demands all under his command train with the bow.
A hero feared and renowned in much of Araby.
Those proven proficient in magic are gifted the Rattlesnake Staff by the Wizard Caliph, it is the mark of any good Arabyan sorcerer.
Endless days in the dunes has left this one dogged and burly.
Fine heavy armour, though its weight stifles movement.
His mind is as immovable as his body.
Ancient sword art which dazzles the many who have not seen it.
They twist and turn like a fierce sandstorm.
The Golden Magus had fought against the Vampire Coast bitterly, and now makes use of their necromantic arts against them.
A Sheikh will often require a reliable stallion to transport him across the battlefield to where he is needed most.

One major advantage the camel provides for these mounted archers is simply a better angle for their arrows to aim true than from their horse counterparts. Albeit, mounted archery on a camel is no easy task!
An officer will often require a reliable stallion to transport him across the battlefield to where he is needed most.
The barded steeds of the nobles are the greatest chargers from a nation that prides itself on its equestrian pedigree.
Elephants are unstoppable beasts. Trained on the battlefield, they lead Araby's leaders to war, wiping out everything that gets in their way.
Palace Guard are among the most prestigious soldiers, tasked with the protection of the Sheiks.
Some only fight for fame and glory, becoming well-trained champions in the process.
It is important to stay grounded when climbing up the chain of command.
Even from within their vessels the Djinn will protect their masters.
They won't feel a thing... unless you want them to.
When you are the target of a Hashishi, you'll never know it until it is too late.
After years of service and loyalty, a Hashishi will receive the mark of the brotherhood.
Armed with long-barrelled arquebus of Arabyan design, the endless deserts have taught these men the value of marksmanship and an accurate firearm.
Even the smallest acts of kindness can mean to world to someone in need.
Some people simply can't get enough.
In the eyes of the brave, danger gleams like sunshine.
This one has gained deep knowledge about local cultures and politics.
A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.
People say you can't trust him, he'll betray anybody for the right price.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve his long-term aims.
This one ensures that those captured in battle wished they'd died on the field, so great is the cruelty that awaits them.
Let me spread my most muculent gift!
Gifted Halflings who have defended the Moot and all within are presented a magical staff from the creatures of Altern Forest.
Dried and treated Tobacco from the Greenleaf plantations are woven into impossible robes showcasing various runes of protection.
My pies are second to none, my proof you ask, well look at my troops, not one can even run!
They said my love of the Halfing's weed would dull my senses but who can resist a puff of Greenleaves finest!
Halflings of the upper echelons of society are friendly and industrious and just like all halflings are perceived as weak but they use this misconception to their advantage.
Kept by the Elder of the Moot,  the great book Haffenlyver lists the great heroes and notable halfling families. To be entered onto its pages is an honour like no other.
Magic does not come easily to the Halflings and most are only ever able to perform cheap parlor tricks, this does keep the rabble amused though.
The Halflings have long had an affinity with nature and both have come to each other's aid in times of need.
There is an art to making soup a deadly weapon the viscosity, temperature and so on has to be carefully considered and when done right no-one, however mighty, will be laughing.
There’s some good in this world and it’s worth fighting for!
They came in search of food but what they found was home.
Our friends are out there. They need our help! They cannot fight this war on their own.
The closer we are to danger, the farther we are from harm.
Despite not being a Master Chef, a Cook as a leader is always seen as a good sign for a Halfling army.
This one is pretending to be more than he really is and he's quite good at it.
Ogres respect Halflings - they have quite the gut for their small size. And this Halfling has an even bigger gut than most others.
A healthy and stable homegrown diet is the base of every Halfling society - and their armies.
Wardens are the professional warriors of the Moot. They are highly respected by other Halflings.
This ring is so shiny and pretty - my precious! But then again, this necklace is also quite nice looking....
Most Halflings prefer a comfortable, safe life at home. Some however are drawn to foreign lands with a compulsion to explore.
The cheapest supplies, who cares if the food doesn't taste that good as long as it fills the soldier's stomachs? Well, the soldiers certainly do...
This finely crafted medallion has been passed down through the Stormriders for generations. Preserved with tempestuous magical knowledge, it was a gift from the Mages of Hoeth long ago.
Astride his griffon, Sharpclaw, Althran swoops down on his chosen foe and cuts them down with talon and beak.
The Starblade like its lance variant is forged from the metal of a fallen star, the weapon's graceful lines belie the formidable power it grants its wielder.
This magical Armour of Fortune is an ancient family heirloom, and so beautifully crafted that the wearer's freedom of movement is completely unimpaired.
Just like his ancestors, Althran looks beyond Ulthuan borders to ensure no foe sets foot upon her shores.
The world descends into Chaos and she will never be tamed! But Ulthuan does not have to share this mortal fate.

With an ancestry dating back to the first Phoenix Kings, Althran's ancestors have led Asuryan armies all around the world, earning great glory and renown. Althran is determined to carry on this grand tradition, and will stop at nothing to protect his people and the domains of Ulthuan.
Capable of reactions so fast, Althran makes even the quickest Swordmaster of Hoeth look clumsy in comparison.

Boglar Shamans are often gifted Marsh Hounds by the Fimir. It can be considered a form of reward or punishment. If the Hound devours the Shaman, it was a punishment. If the Shaman tames the hound, it was a reward.
In the long run a troll champion cannot hold a horde together, but in the midst of battle his presence is enough to keep the trolls in line.
Not as impressive - or repulsive - as a Troll lord, but still deadly enough.
Maybe his intelligence is not too impressive, but violence alone can be enough to keep the weaker trolls in line.
A troll's hygiene is never impressive, but this disgusting creature reeks so badly that a constant swarm of flies is buzzing around it at all times.
Most troll's are easy to anger, but this one is more vicious than others.
Not only are its wounds healing rapidily, on top of that it is difficult to actually injure this troll.
Trolls look slow and lumbering, but can be surprisingly fast. This one is faster than most though.
The Rotfather will not see his followers perish from mundane wounds, when he has so much more to bequeath unto them.
Norscans flock to a powerful lord like flies to carrion.
